intro: Clinopodium vulgare var. gracile, commonly known as slender lemon grass, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale blue to purple flowers appear in whorled clusters, and it is often found in meadows and woodland edges. The leaves and flowering tops are used in herbal teas and have a mild, lemony scent due to the presence of volatile oils.
